Morgan Schneiderlin proved just why Everton have forked out over £20m for his services in his very first training session. 
The midfielder was in action at the club's Finch Farm training ground on Friday after arriving from Manchester United. 
He is in contention to face Man City this weekend - and showed just what he will offer. 
Taking part in a shooting drill, Schneiderlin curled a stunning effort into the top corner past Joel Robles. 
Speaking in his pre-match press conference, Ronald Koeman revealed he will give the player every chance to face City - despite his lack of match action. New Everton signing Morgan Schneiderlin (Photo: Everton FC via Getty) Kevin Mirallas and Morgan Schneiderlin challenge for the ball (Photo: Everton FC via Getty) 
"We know each other very well and I kept in contact with him. For Everton, he's a big signing. 
"He’s a midfield player that I like, [he has] different qualities, can play as a holding midfielder, attacking midfielder, he’s aggressive, he brings qualities to Everton. 
"Morgan is fit but we will make the decision on Saturday about whether he is in the squad." Koeman with Schneiderlin (Photo: Everton FC via Getty Images) 
The midfielder also discussed why he was so keen to join Everton after being allowed to leave Old Trafford. 
“I wanted to go to an ambitious club, who could meet my expectations, especially in terms of playing time, because I wanted to get on the pitch 
“It’s a big Premier League club and the coach has great ambitions to bring them to the top six or even in the top five. It is interesting to me. 
“It’s true that a lot of teams have expressed interest abroad, but the Premier League is a championship that has always attracted me. I feel good. I wanted to stay a little longer to enjoy this beautiful football.” poll loading Will Morgan Schneiderlin be a success at Everton? 3000+ VOTES SO FAR
